task.title: Create Publications and Deliverables in Oxygen
task.shortdesc: In this step, you create Publications and Deliverables necessary to connect the Oxygen files to an external connector, in this case, Netlify.

step.cmd: In the upper left of your Oxygen project, click on the title of your project to leave your Personal workspace.
Create a new Publication for your project

substep.cmd: Click Publications on the left side of the page
Select the blue New Publications button on the upper right side of the page
Name your publication something relevant to your project
Select DITA Map Path, then selection ditamap.ditamap
Ignore the DITAVAL path section
Select the blue "Create" button at the bottom of the window

step.cmd: Create a new Connector for your project

substep.cmd: On the left side of the page, select the word "Connectors"
Select the blue button that says "NEW CONNECTOR"
Select Netlify from the drop-down menu
Enter a relevant name for your project, and copy and paste your Netlify site ID.
For the Access Token, return to Netlify.
Type Access Token in the search bar, and then select Personal access tokens when it appears.
Select "New access token" from the section labeled "Personal access tokens"
Create a label for the token that is relevant to your project as well as the amount of time the token will be valid for
Select "Generate token"
Copy the token to your clipboard and paste it in the Personal Access Token section on Oxygen.
Click Submit

step.cmd: Create a new Deliverable in Oxygen

substep.cmd: Select the Deliverables icon on the left side of the page
Click the blue "NEW DELIVERABLE" button on the upper right
Give it a name and description relevant to your project
Select your publication from the dropdown menu under Publication
If you want, you can choose a template for your color scheme under "Select a Template:"
Check the box for "Upload output using a publishing connector", then choose your Connector from the dropdown menu
Select BUILD next to your new Deliverable, and it will build your website using Netlify.

step.cmd: Open your new website in Netlify

substep.cmd: Return to Netlify and go back to your website overview.
Below the randomly generated website name is your url for your website. If you click on it, it takes you to your page!
